metadata.title: MIT KRB5 KDC is installed on Linux
metadata.description: MIT KRB5 KDC is installed on Linux

criterion.comment: Linux is installed
MIT KRB5 KDC is installed

metadata.title: Secure the KDC database file (database_name)
metadata.description: The database_name directive specifies the location of the Berkeley DB file that the KDC uses as a database backend. Ensure that the database_name is owned by root:root and is not accessible by any principal other than root.

criterion.comment: Fetch database_name value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf
Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has database_name is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default database_name i.e principal file of [realms] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos database file (database_name)
metadata.description: The database_name directive specifies the location of the Kerberos database on the file system. This directive is significant only when a Berkeley DB database type is configured. Ensure that access to the Kerberos database reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Fetch database_name value in [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf
Ensure each realm of [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf has database_name is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default database_name i.e principal file of [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Ensure kadmin and KDC run as different LDAP users
metadata.description: When using LDAP as a Kerberos backend, the two server components, kadmind and kdc, each have an LDAP user DN configured with ldap_kadmind_dn and ldap_kdc_dn.

criterion.comment: Fetch ldap_kadmind_dn value directive value from [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf
Fetch ldap_kdc_dn value directive value from [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos Access Control List (kadm5.acl)
metadata.description: The Kerberos kadmind daemon uses kadm5.acl to manage access rights to the Kerberos database. Ensure access to kadm5.acl reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kadm5.acl file permission

metadata.title: Secure the KDC daemon binary (krb5kdc)
metadata.description: The KDC daemon is implemented as an executable service, krb5kdc. Ensure access to the KDC daemon executable reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify krb5kdc file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos host key table manipulation utility (k5srvutil)
metadata.description: The Kerberos host key table manipulation utility is implemented as an executable command line tool, karb5-send-pr, and is used to list, change, or remove keys in a given keytab. Ensure access to the Kerberos host key table manipulation utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify k5srvutil file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos database administration tool binary (kadmin)
metadata.description: The Kerberos database administration tool is implemented as an executable command line tool, kadmin. Ensure access to the Kerberos administration server reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kadmin file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the kdestroy utility
metadata.description: The kdestroy utility is used to destroy a given user's active Kerberos authorization tickets as they exist in the credential cache. Ensure access to the kdestroy utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kdestroy file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the kinit utility
metadata.description: The kinit utility is used to create and cache Kerberos ticket-granting tickets. Ensure access to the kinit reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kinit file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the klist utility
metadata.description: The klist utility is used to list cached Kerberos tickets. Ensure access to the klist utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify klist file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the kpasswd utility
metadata.description: The kpasswd utility is used to change a given user's Kerberos password. Ensure access to the kpasswd utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kpasswd file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the krb5-config utility
metadata.description: The krb5-config utility is used for linking against MIT Kerberos libraries. Ensure access to the krb5-config utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify krb5-config file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the ksu utility
metadata.description: The ksu utility is a kerberized implementation of the su command and can be used to switch user IDs. Ensure access to the ksu utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify ksu file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the kswitch utility
metadata.description: The kswitch utility is used to set the given credential cache to the primary credential cache. Ensure access to the kswitch utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kswitch file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the ktutil utility
metadata.description: The ktutil utility is used perform maintenance tasks on a given keytab. Ensure access to the ktutil utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify ktutil file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos administration server daemon binary (kadmind)
metadata.description: The Kerberos administration server is implemented as an executable service, kadmind. Ensure access to the Kerberos administration server reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kadmind file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos database administration utility binary (kadmin.local)
metadata.description: The Kerberos database administration utility is implemented as an executable command line tool, kadmin.local. Ensure access to the Kerberos administration server reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kadmin.local file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos configuration utility binary (kdb5_ldap_util)
metadata.description: The Kerberos configuration utility is implemented as an executable command line tool, kdb5_ldap_util. Ensure access to the Kerberos administration server reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kdb5_ldap_util file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos configuration utility binary (kdb5_util)
metadata.description: The Kerberos configuration utility is implemented as an executable command line tool, kdb5_util. Ensure access to the Kerberos administration server reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kdb5_util file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos propagation utility binary (kprop)
metadata.description: The Kerberos database propagation utility is implemented as an executable command line tool, kprop. Ensure access to the Kerberos database propagation utility reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kprop file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos slave KDC update daemon binary (kpropd)
metadata.description: The Kerberos slave KDC update daemon binary is implemented as an executable service, kpropd. Ensure access to the Kerberos slave KDC update daemon binary reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kpropd file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos propagation log utility binary (kproplog)
metadata.description: The Kerberos propagation log utility binary is implemented as an executable command line tool, kproplog, and is used to display the contents of the Kerberos principal update log. Ensure access to the Kerberos propagation log utility binary reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kproplog file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos problem report utility binary (krb5-send-pr)
metadata.description: The Kerberos problem report utility binary is implemented as an executable command line tool, krb5-send-pr, and is used to submit problem reports to a central support site. Ensure access to the Kerberos problem report utility binary reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify krb5-send-pr file permissions

metadata.title: Ensure restrict_anonymous_to_tgt is set to true
metadata.description: This option allows anonymous PKINIT to be enabled for use as FAST armor tickets without allowing anonymous authentication to services. If set to true, the KDC will reject ticket requests from anonymous principals to service principals other than the realm's ticket-granting service.

criterion.comment: Ensure [kdcdefaults] section in kdc.conf has restrict_anonymous_to_tgt directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos database access control file (acl_file)
metadata.description: The acl_file directive specifies the location of the ACL file that kadmin uses to determine a given principal's permissions on the Kerberos database. Ensure that the acl_file is owned by root:root and is not accessible by any principal other than root.

criterion.comment: Fetch acl_file value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf
Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has acl_file is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default acl_file i.e kadm5.acl file of [realms] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Ensure the 'master_key_name' is set to 'K/M'
metadata.description: This string specifies the name of the principal associated with the master key. The default value is K/M.

criteria.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_name directive

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section
Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_name directive set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure master_key_type is using a strong encryption algorithm
metadata.description: This directive controls the master key's key type. It is recommended to only use an algorithm from the following list: * aes256-cts-hmac-sha1-96 * aes128-cts-hmac-sha1-96 * des3-cbc-sha1 * arcfour-hmac-md5

criteria.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_type directive

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section
Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_type directive set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure 'max_life' is 24 hours or less
metadata.description: This directive uses a timedelta to specify the maximum time period that a ticket may be valid for in this realm.

criteria.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having max_life directive

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section
Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having max_life directive set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure max_renewable_life is less than 14 days
metadata.description: This directive controls the maximum time period that a ticket may be renewed.

criteria.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_type directive

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section
Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having max_renewable_life directive set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure only strong encryption types are supported (supported_enctypes)
metadata.description: The supported_enctypes directive specifies the default key/salt combinations for this realm. Any principals created through kadmin will have keys of these types. Ensure the supported_enctypes directive includes only strong key/salt combinations.

criteria.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having supported_enctypes directive settings

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section
Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having supported_enctypes directive set as appropriate

metadata.title: Secure the kadmin keytab (admin_keytab)
metadata.description: The admin_keytab directive specifies the location of the keytab file that kadmin uses to authenticate to the database. Ensure that the admin_keytab is owned by root:root and is not accessible by any principal other than root.

criterion.comment: Fetch admin_keytab value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf
Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has admin_keytab is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default admin_keytab i.e /usr/local/var/krb5kdc/kadm5.keytab file of [realms] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Ensure 'reject_bad_transit' is set to 'true'
metadata.description: This boolean specifies whether or not the list of transited realms for cross-realm tickets should be checked against the transit path computed from the realm names and the [capaths] section of its krb5.conf. If this value is set to false, such tickets will be issued anyways, and it will be left up to the application server to validate the realm transit path.

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having reject_bad_transit directive set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure that 'pwservice' is not in the 'default_principal_flags'
metadata.description: The pwservice flag a principal as a password change service, which grants it permission to change passwords without going through normal password authentication.

criteria.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_type directive

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section
Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having default_principal_flags directive set as appropriate

metadata.title: Secure the dictionary file (dict_file)
metadata.description: The dict_file directive specifies the location of the file that contains values that are not allowed as passwords. Ensure that the dict_file is owned by root:root and is writable by any principal other than root.

criterion.comment: Fetch dict_file value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf
Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has dict_file is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Secure KDC key stash file (key_stash_file)
metadata.description: The key_stash_file directive specifies the file containing the master key as stored with kdb5_stash. Ensure access to the file referenced by the key_stash_file directive reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Fetch key_stash_file value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf
Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has key_stash_file is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default key_stash_file i.e /usr/local/var/.k5.REALM file of [realms] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Ensure "Last successful authentication" field is updated (disable_last_success)
metadata.description: The disable_last_success directive determine if the KDC will suppress updates to the "Last successful authentication" field of principal entries requiring preauthentication. Ensure that "Last success authentication" events are not suppressed.

criterion.comment: Ensure [dbmodules] section in kdc.conf has disable_last_success directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure account lockouts are not disabled (disable_lockout)
metadata.description: The disable_lockout directive determine if the KDC will suppress updates to the "Last failed authentication" and "Failed password attempts" field of principal entries requiring preauthentication. Ensure that these events are not suppressed.

criterion.comment: Ensure [dbmodules] section in kdc.conf has disable_lockout directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Secure the LDAP server password file (ldap_service_password_file)
metadata.description: The ldap_service_password_file directive specifies the file containing the stashed passwords for the ldap_kadmind_dn and ldap_kdc_dn objects. This directive is only significant if the LDAP database type is configured. Ensure access to the file referenced by the ldap_service_password_file directive reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Fetch ldap_service_password_file directive value from [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf
Ensure ldap_service_password_file directive file path value in [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Secure the default location (default)
metadata.description: The default logging entry determines where logs are sent in the absence of an explicit entry for a given role, such as kdc and admin_server. The default logging entry may be prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, STDERR, CONSOLE, DEVICE, or SYSLOG. For all default entries prefixed with FILE= or FILE:, ensure access to the specified location reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Fetch default directive value from [logging] section in kdc.conf
Ensure default directive file path value in [logging] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Secure the kdc log location (kdc)
metadata.description: The kdc logging entry determines where the KDC logs are sent. The kdc logging entry may be prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, STDERR, CONSOLE, DEVICE, or SYSLOG. For all kdc entries prefixed with FILE= or FILE:, ensure access to the specified location reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Fetch kdc directive value from [logging] section in kdc.conf
Ensure kdc directive file path value in [logging] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Secure the administrative server log location (admin_server)
metadata.description: The admin_server logging entry determines where the administrative server logs are sent. The admin_server logging entry may be prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, STDERR, CONSOLE, DEVICE, or SYSLOG. For all admin_server entries prefixed with FILE= or FILE:, ensure access to the specified location reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Fetch admin_server directive value from [logging] section in /etc/admin_server.conf
Ensure admin_server directive file path value in [logging] section in /etc/admin_server.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Ensure a persistent log sink is configured for default log location
metadata.description: The default logging entry determines where logs are sent in the absence of an explicit entry for a given role, such as kdc and admin_server. The default logging entry may be prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, STDERR, CONSOLE, DEVICE, or SYSLOG. Ensure at least one default entry is prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, DEVICE, or SYSLOG.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists and has default directive present
Ensure [logging] section in kdc.conf has default directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure a persistent log sink is configured for kdc logging
metadata.description: The kdc logging entry determines where the KDC logs are sent. The kdc logging entry may be prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, STDERR, CONSOLE, DEVICE, or SYSLOG. Ensure at least one kdc entry is prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, DEVICE, or SYSLOG.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists and has kdc directive present
Ensure [logging] section in kdc.conf has kdc directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure a persistent log sink is configured for administrative server logging
metadata.description: The admin_server logging entry determines where the administrative server logs are sent. The admin_server logging entry may be prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, STDERR, CONSOLE, DEVICE, or SYSLOG. Ensure at least one admin_server entry is prefixed by FILE=, FILE:, DEVICE, or SYSLOG.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists and has admin_server directive present
Ensure [logging] section in kdc.conf has admin_server directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Secure the KDC configuration file (kdc.conf)
metadata.description: The KDC configuration file contains directives that dictate how the Kerberos Authentication Service and Key Distribution Center (AS/KDC) operate. Ensure access to the KDC configuration file reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify kdc.conf file permissions

metadata.title: Secure the default keytab (default_keytab_name)
metadata.description: A keytab is a file that contains Kerberos principles and encrypted keys. The default keytab is typically used to identify the local kerberos service to the KDC.

criterion.comment: Fetch default_keytab_name directive value in [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf
Ensure default_keytab_name directive file path value in [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default default_keytab_name file path i.e /etc/krb5.keytab file of [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

metadata.title: Ensure AES256 is the preferred encryption type for TGS (default_tgs_enctypes)
metadata.description: The default_tgs_enctypes directive specifies the list of session key encryption types supported by the Kerberos library. Ensure this directive is configured to prefer AES256.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and default_tgs_enctypes directive is present
Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has default_tgs_enctypes directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure single DES-based encryption types are disallowed for TGS (default_tgs_enctypes)
metadata.description: The default_tgs_enctypes directive specifies the list of session key encryption types supported by the Kerberos library. Ensure this directive disallows Single DES-based encryption types.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and default_tgs_enctypes directive is present
Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has default_tgs_enctypes directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure AES256 is the preferred encryption type for TKT (default_tkt_enctypes)
metadata.description: The default_tkt_enctypes directive specifies the list of session key encryption types requested by the client. Ensure this directive is configured to prefer AES256.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and has default_tkt_enctypes directive present
Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has default_tkt_enctypes directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure single DES-based encryption types are disallowed for TKT (default_tkt_enctypes)
metadata.description: The default_tkt_enctypes directive specifies the list of session key encryption types supported by the Kerberos library. Ensure this directive disallows single DES-based encryption types.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and has default_tkt_enctypes directive present
Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has default_tkt_enctypes directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure single DES-based encryption types are not permitted (permitted_enctypes)
metadata.description: The permitted_enctypes directive specifies the list of permitted encryption types. Ensure this directive disallows Single DES-based encryption types.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and has permitted_enctypes directive present
Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has permitted_enctypes directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Disallow weak encryption types (allow_weak_crypto)
metadata.description: The allow_weak_crypto directive determines if weak encryption types are permitted. Ensure this directive is configured to disallow weak encryption types.

criterion.comment: Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has allow_weak_crypto directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure clockskew tolerance is minimized (clockskew)
metadata.description: The clockskew directive determines the maximum allowable amount of clockskew in seconds that the library will tolerate before assuming that a Kerberos message is invalid. Ensure this directive is set to less than or equal to five minutes.

criteria.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and it has proper setting

criterion.comment: Ensure krb5.conf file exists and clockskew directive is present
Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has clockskew directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Ensure ignore_acceptor_hostname is not set to true
metadata.description: When accepting GSSAPI or krb5 security contexts for host-based service principals, ignore any hostname passed by the calling application and allow any service principal present in the keytab which matches the service name and realm name (if given). This option can improve the administrative flexibility of server applications on multi-homed hosts, but can compromise the security of virtual hosting environments.

criterion.comment: Ensure [libdefaults] section in krb5.conf has ignore_acceptor_hostname directive is set as appropriate

metadata.title: Prevent blank password creation (pwqual:empty)
metadata.description: The password quality interface (pwqual) has a built-in module, named empty, that will reject attempts to set a blank password. Ensure the empty module is enabled.

criterion.comment: Ensure empty is present on the enable_only directive line in pwqual interface of [plugins] section in krb5.conf file
Ensure empty is not present on disable directive line in pwqual interface of [plugins] section in krb5.conf file

metadata.title: Prevent dictionary word password creation (pwqual:dict)
metadata.description: The password quality interface (pwqual) has a built-in module, named dict, that will reject attempts to set a password that is present in the realm's dictionary file. Ensure the dict module is enabled.

criterion.comment: Ensure dict is present on the enable_only directive line in pwqual interface of [plugins] section in krb5.conf file
Ensure dict is not present on disable directive line in pwqual interface of [plugins] section in krb5.conf file

metadata.title: Prevent creation of passwords derived from the principal's name (pwqual:princ)
metadata.description: The password quality interface (pwqual) has a built-in module, named princ, that will reject attempts to set a password that is derived from the principal's name. Ensure the princ module is enabled.

criterion.comment: Ensure princ is present on the enable_only directive line in pwqual interface of [plugins] section in krb5.conf file
Ensure princ is not present on disable directive line in pwqual interface of [plugins] section in krb5.conf file

metadata.title: Secure the Kerberos configuration file (krb5.conf)
metadata.description: The Kerberos configuration file contains information needed by the Kerberos library, including descriptions of realms and the location of the KDC for those realms. Ensure access to the Kerberos configuration file reflects least privilege.

criterion.comment: Verify krb5.conf file permissions

metadata.title: Ensure 'kiprop' principles are only allowed 'propagation' permission
metadata.description: Principles named kiprop/* are used for Kerberos propagation.

criterion.comment: Fetch acl_file directive value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf
Ensure acl_file directive file in each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has proper kiprop setting
Ensure default acl_file i.e kadm5.acl file has proper kiprop setting

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Fetch database_name value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf

file_test.comment: Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has database_name is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default database_name i.e principal file of [realms] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Fetch database_name value in [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf

file_test.comment: Ensure each realm of [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf has database_name is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default database_name i.e principal file of [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

Fetch ldap_kdc_dn value directive value from [dbdefaults] section in kdc.conf
Ensure [kdcdefaults] section in kdc.conf has restrict_anonymous_to_tgt directive is set as appropriate

file_test.comment: Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has acl_file is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default acl_file i.e kadm5.acl file of [realms] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section

variable_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_name directive set as appropriate

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section

variable_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having master_key_type directive set as appropriate

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section

variable_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having max_life directive set as appropriate

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section

variable_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having max_renewable_life directive set as appropriate

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section

variable_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having supported_enctypes directive set as appropriate

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Fetch admin_keytab value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf

file_test.comment: Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has admin_keytab is secured with appropriate permissions
Ensure default admin_keytab i.e /usr/local/var/krb5kdc/kadm5.keytab file of [realms] section in kdc.conf is secured with appropriate permissions

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having reject_bad_transit directive set as appropriate
Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section

variable_test.comment: Ensure kdc.conf file exists with [realms] section, with each realm having default_principal_flags directive set as appropriate

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Fetch dict_file value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf

file_test.comment: Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has dict_file is secured with appropriate permissions

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Fetch key_stash_file value for each realm in [realms] section in kdc.conf

file_test.comment: Ensure each realm of [realms] section in kdc.conf has key_stash_file is secured with appropriate permissions

textfilecontent54_test.comment: Ensure [dbmodules] section in kdc.conf has disable_last_success directive is set as appropriate
